Reviews.Title: Very pleased so far. *EDITED*
Reviews.Author: Irishlady
Reviews.Content: I guess I'll break the ice and be the first to review this TV.I searched for a decent 37" TV at a reasonable price and looked at several different brands. I almost bought a Vizio because of the price, but then I found this Toshiba for less than 600$. Here is what I can say about it so far:This TV has a very good picture especially on the Directv hi-def channels. It has some interesting features that I have not yet used such as:the ability to play picture files (like a giant digital photo frame, andthe ability to play MUSIC files, like a giant Mp3 player.When I press the "mute" (to mute the sound)button, it will mute half way, then another press of the button mutes the sound completely.It has a computer terminal for connecting a PC.It has 4 HDMI inputs.The reason I gave this TV 4 stars is the viewing angles--like most LCDs, you need to sit almost directly in front of the screen. If you try and watch it too far off to one side, the colors get a bit washed out.For an auxillary TV, this one fits the bill. My home theatre TV is a 50" plasma, and that TV blows this one away. But if you just want a fairly large TV for everyday watching and not the whole "home theatre" experience, you will be pleased with this unit. I think Toshiba is a decent brand and most of the reviews on other Toshiba models have been pretty good.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS TV LIKE A SON!!!
Reviews.Author: SteveB
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this TV to replace my Samsung 27" tube HDTV which was an absolute beast (147 lbs!).  This TV is WONDERFUL!  It's the 3rd Toshiba LCD in my house (also have a 32" in my bedroom and a 19" in the home office).  The picture is crystal clear with rich, bright, vibrant colors.  I watch a lot of sports and play video games on this TV and it performs great for both.  There aren't noticeable tracers when watching fast action.  I wish it had a regular a/v sound output (red & white), but it only offers a digital audio output which doesn't work w/ my out-dated receiver (not the TV's fault).  I compared this side-by-side to LG's similarly priced 37" model and it blew the LG away.  The picture was brighter, clearer, and lost less quality at an angle.  I've noticed some reviews that are critical of the TV's sound, but I'm not having any issues with it.  I'm sure it doesn't compare to the sound quality of a home theatre system, but it isn't any worse than any other TV I've owned.  If you're looking to get the most bang for your buck on a moderately priced lcd TV, this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Mike V
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this one short and sweet. Ive had this TV for several weeks now, and couldn't be happier.The picture is awesome. Our other TV is a Samsung 40 inch, which is another highly rated LCD, and I made my own comparison by watching a Stanley Cup Hockey game on both TV's and could not tell any difference. A Hockey game broadcast in HD is a very good test for your TV's clarity, and this Toshiba did not disappoint.The dynamic aspect ratio works great.The fact that Toshiba doesn't publish the contrast ratio should not be a deterrent for getting this TV. Contrast ratio is a marketing gimmick, and the determination should be that if you look at the picture, and it looks great to your eyes, who cares what the actual contrast ratio is? The blacks look black, and the whites look white, and there isn't much more to worry about.Good price for a great TV!

Reviews.Title: Just got this HD TV yesterday...WOW!
Reviews.Author: Mark B. Sears
Reviews.Content: I took ownership of this HD TV yesterday and all I have to say is this thing is great!* easy to setup* easy to program* picture quality is incredible* paid $483 USD for it and it's worth every penny* More HDMI slots than devices to hook up to it* setup the XBOX 360 on the port on the side panel with easeThis HD TV has to be comparable to a Samsung, with a much lower price point.  I strongly recommend this HD TV.

Reviews.Title: didn't work right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Jillian L. Staley "whateva"
Reviews.Content: *UPDATE UNDER THIS REVIEW*  I haven't even been able to watch my brand new TV yet.  I plugged all of my things into it, turned it on, and there were all these horizontal lines going across it, making the picture all messed up.  i called customer service and they had me call a local company to fix it.  local company came by the next day to pick it up.  they told me it was the screen, and that they'd have to order that in, which would take about 10 days.  so Ive now owned this thing for about a week and cant even watch it until it gets fixed, which will be just in time for me to leave town for the holidays.  im definitely not happy with this purchase.  i sure hope i have no problems with it after i get it back.*UPDATE*I am returning this television today.  Toshiba's customer service has been giving me the run around on getting this thing fixed, and I'm unable to put up with it any longer.  I bought this on Cyber Monday, and still haven't been able to use it.  Their customer service kept losing my paperwork, so no one has been able to answer my questions as to why I haven't been able to get my tv back yet.  Finally I get a call back (after at least a week of being told that, whoops, we lost your paperwork, someone eill definitely be calling you back today) from a "manager" (unprofessional sounding and insincere) who told me that the part I need is on indefinite backorder.  I asked her why they just won't send me a new once, since I didn't break it, and it didn't work from the very moment I plugged it in.  She told me that isn't an option and I have to get it fixed by them.  I told them I don't want a refurbished television when I paid for a brand new one.  She wasn't really happy with my opinion.  So, I'm sending it back to Amazon.  I went and picked it up from the local repair company and it is on its way to Amazon as we speak.  Thank you Amazon, for having no problems with this return, especially when I've gotten such a run-around from Toshiba.  I will never buy another product from them again!

Reviews.Title: Great TV...Horrible shipping
Reviews.Author: lawguy20
Reviews.Content: Let first comment on the TV...its fantastic! Great picture in either standard or high def. The sound is great as well. I replaced a 4 year old 32in Westinghouse and this just blows it away. Absolutely no complaints about the TV.Now, as far as shipping goes...I can't believe Amazon uses these people. The company is called Ceva Logistics. These people were the most unprofessional individuals I have ever delt with (when it comes to shipping companies). I see my package is due to be delivered on the 4th...ok sounds good. It didn't come. Fine, I now the estimates are usually just that...an estimate. So I check the status and I see that the package is at the destination location (about 7 miles from where I  live). So, i figure it would come the next day (friday). Well, I'm at work and i get a call asking if I want to come pick up my TV from the distribution center...what?!? I ordered it online and wanted it delivered. That is what Amazon is all about...ordering from your computer to your door. Neither me nor my wife have cars (we rely on public transit and bikes) so picking it up was not an option. They tell me that since I can't pick it up myself that I'll have to wait until monday and schedule a delivery appointment....when asked why they couldn't just deliver it because my wife would be home they got an attitude and  said "thats not how we do things". So I asked to schedule an appointment and he told me to call back monday....seriously, the TV had been there now for 2 days! So Monday rolls around and I call to make and appointment and they give me a four hour window between 10-2pm. So when does my TV get delivered? 2:45. I have never had so much trouble getting a package in my life....I hope Amazon stops using these people!

Reviews.Title: Quality HDTV
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Before I purchased my hdtv, i did plenty of research, and compared many tvs. I really had my eye on a samsung 37 in. but the price was a little out of budget for me. I saw a toshiba like this one in an electronic store and liked the picture quality, but hated the actual design of the tv. It looked cheesy and I wasnt sure how it would hold up in the long run. After months of deciding which tv i wanted, I saw the toshiba discounted here, and on impulse purchased it, and haven't looked back since. The look of the tv has since grown on me, and the quality of the picture is stunning and definitely comparable to other more expensive tvs. The sound quality is like any other hdtv with built in speakers, but by no means do they sound bad. The glossy screen is not best for day time watching with sun in the room, but in the dark, I think the glossy screen gives the picture a better warmer color which is awesome! The 1080p cant be beat, and it has plenty of hdmi imports for bluray, cable etc, also the 60 hz looks just right to me, not too fast and not too slow, to me tvs with 120hz true-motion just look too fast moving for my liking.  I highly recommend this tv to any indecisive buyers like my self who are looking for something affordable, and not too big for bedroom or living room use.

Reviews.Title: Can't imagine a more versatile HDTV that's a better value!!
Reviews.Author: S. Gerber "samthewebman"
Reviews.Content: I only write Amazon Reviews when I have strong feelings toward or against a product. This review is DEFINITELY a positive one.Have had this Toshiba for three weeks now. MY first HDTV, replacing a 27" very competent Sony 27" WEGA.Like all of you I wanted a great picture, great sound, good value, a good brand from a trusted well known manufacturer, and especially in my case, I wanted a high level of connectivity. I have a VCR that's attached by composite video cables, and ditto with a DVD player. Also, I want the ability to watch a different program while I'm taping a program. This will be the keynote of this review.The Comcast cable coming to my bedroom was split. One cable attached to their cable box and the other cable to nothing. (Too cheap and principled to buy 2 cable boxes for a single TV). To make this work I had an A-B switch to select the cable to be used and feed it to the Sony's Cable/Antenna input.The Toshiba was so rich in connectivity with 2 composite inputs, one component, and 4 HDMI that it solved all my connectivity issues without an A-B switch and with full and automatic support for my legacy, low-res (480i) devices. If you're still interested at all, here's what I did:My Comcast Hi-Def cable box is HDMI connected. It feeds my VCR for taping. The VCR connects to the Toshiba on composite input, as does the DVD player. Comcast supplied me with a no-charge digital adapter for cable input to the Toshiba's Cable/Antenna input. It's called a DTA device (Digital Transport Adapter). The magic of this is that the DTA can unscramble the many non-analog broadcasts so that it can deliver the entire channel lineup I'm paying for, not just the 7 local channels available without it. The piece de resistance is that both the cable box and the DTA are tuned by remote controls that do NOT conflict with each other. The only sacrifice I made is that when my hi-def box is occupied doing a taping, I can only watch standard def on the DTA, a small price to pay to avoid having to buy a second cable box or a 2-tuner DVR. Standard def is very sharp on the Toshiba, as it was on my Sony WEGA.The Toshiba has a very easy-to-use feature set which allows me to select automatic aspect ratio recognition, as well as a manual override to use full width for standard def (which I hate) and a choice of 3 "Theater" modes. I have it set where everything is automatic. My VCR is always recognized as 480i and I have right and left edges with a 4:3 aspect ratio. Ditto when I play a DVD. When I watch TV broadcasts the low-def stations are always seen as 4:3 and the hi-def as 16:9, no user setting required. As a bonus, when I play a 16:9 formatted movie on DVD, I can quickly use one of the theater modes to fill the Toshiba's massive screen. No Blu_Ray required.Sorry for boring those of you who aren't so anal about wanting all these features but this Toshiba screamed at me "I'm the TV you want!".For those Comcast users among you who want to do what I'm doing, I'll supply model numbers for the Hi-Def Cable box and the DTA if you request this by commenting the review.Haven't tried the USB and PC inputs yet, but I plan to bring my laptop into play so that I can use it to stream Netflix videos to the TV. I don't want to waste my TV playing MP3 music or watch JPG slide shows.Sorry for the long review but don't pass up this Toshiba if you want a great picture, totally acceptable sound, and a myriad of connectivity options.Thanks for reading ... Sam

Reviews.Title: Great Value Buy
Reviews.Author: Bronson747
Reviews.Content: When I first pulled this TV out of the box I was a bit concerned because it was so light.  Its 30 pounds.  I thought sure this will be easy to setup and move around if I need to, but will there be a trade off in sound or picture quality?  The answer is no way.  Great High Def picture and reasonable sound quality.As a value buy this is an extremely reasonably priced set that delivers everything one would need in a TV.

Reviews.Title: Great combo screen
Reviews.Author: J. Quinlan "sois bon avec toi même"
Reviews.Content: Bought this unit primarily for a computer monitor. I am very pleased with the size and clarity from 10 feet away. I like watching and reading news items on the pc and this unit makes it most pleasant with tri-focal glasses. I had a 15 inch tube monitor and found my eyes tiring after a short time. The 37 inch size makes viewing very comfortable.I bought this at a store after reading all the Amazon reviews on various monitor/tv units. It has so many inputs that were new to me that I felt that telling the seller what I needed it for was the only way to get my money worth.This is what I wanted in a unit:A PC monitorConnect my Roku ( Netflix ) HD wireless converterTv channel viewingConnect my analog vcrget rid of my external pc speakersThese desires were met and by buying a wireless keyboard and mouse I now have the pc box under the TV and out of sight.The monitor has a matte finish and does not reflect glare from my windows during the day. This might be the feature I most appreciate.Set-up was very easy.I looked at the unit from 30 feet away at an angle and was able to see the picture just fine. What angle I look at in my living room is not an issue. This is an LCD screen.It has 1080 resolution and Netflix delivers at 780 so I can upgrade my Roku and still be pleased with my unit.It has 5 settings for picture warmth ( color/hue/gamma/etc ). 4 of these settings are factory set and non-changeable and the 5th for personal preference.I use an outdoor digital antenna and as I change channels the Toshiba indicates the strength of the signal. The unit does not have an antenna built in. You must use a cable style antenna or cable service.My analog vcr is now useless for recording without a digital converter box and can't record shows without a converter. Also my previously recorded vcr tapes come on the TV in 480 resolution.It will accept a USB flash device. If you have mp3 or jpg files or want to view the pictures from your camera ( camera cable required with rgb or usb external connection ) you can have a slide show.The HDMI inputs look very similar to a usb connection but the shape is different. All the newer pc's and other devices are coming with this commection. It replaces the s-cable style connector it does not accept s-cable.I had to buy an HDI cable ( connect my Roku ), a stereo speaker cable ( from the pc headphones to the monitor ) with both ends male, and a VGA cable ( computer ) in addition to the unit itself. You can get these from Amazon.It will not play avi files from a usb flash unit. You need the computer for that viewing.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: James R. Storck "postman"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a bedroom tv in the 37" to 40" size. This one fit the bill and the price was hard to pass up especially since the Samsung I was looking at was at least $100 more. Seems to be a great tv so far. The remote is nice and easy to use, the picture is very good and the tv as a whole looks nice. We still have a Toshiba 57" wide screen projection tv from the early 90's and it's still running fine so the brand has something going for it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a very fair price
Reviews.Author: john berry
Reviews.Content: My last TV was a gift from my parents when I was about 12. At 34, it felt like time to buy a big-kid television.That being my perspective on picture quality, it was obviously a HUGE step up for my viewing experience.But comparing it to the HDTV sets that my friends and family have, I feel like this set's quality is completely equal to their sets that cost sometimes twice as much or more.Easy hook up for the cable box, PS3 and Wii made it easy to plug it in and start watching almost immediately.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice
Reviews.Author: kDubb
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit of a technology nerd, but not enough to pick this product apart like some do in reviews. However, I think I can help out the average consumer...I bought this TV for my girlfriend and she LOVES it! I was looking for a decent size LCD with 1080p capabilities, lots of ports, and as for the HZ I prefer 60 myself so I wasn't too concerned about that, and of course, overall, I just wanted the biggest bang for my buck.I researched and compared tons of different models and brands based on what I was looking for and this TV not only met all of my standards, but even exceeded some (4 hdmi ports!).  I couldn't find a better deal out there considering this TV is 37 inches, has plenty of hdmi ports, 1080p, and the set itself looks really good.  This TV is sleek and one of the best looking(aesthetically speaking) models I could find in its category.My gf mostly uses this TV to hook up to her Macbook Pro as an additional monitor or uses the Macbook as a DVD player. I got her a DVI to hdmi cable to hook her computer up to the TV and it looks amazing.  I was extremely impressed with the quality of the picture on the television.Although, I am extremely pleased with this purchase, there are a couple of little things that do bother me about the TV..1. The remote looks cheap and plain - however my gf likes it because it's simple and the buttons are big, haha2. As with a lot of LCD TVs and their remotes, the remote has to be pretty accurately pointed at the sensor on the TV for the TV to respond to the remote.  That's just annoying to me even though it's a common issue.3. The TV is a little slow to respond to switching between different inputs or channels.  I don't think this TV is any slower than most (other than your high end models), but it's still just one of those annoying factors.4.  Another issue with a lot a lcd televisions including this one, the sound could be better.  The sound isn't terrible or anything, it is adequate.  It's just if you really want to enjoy a good action packed movie or show, though, you'll want to purchase some speakers - I did.5. There is no swivel stand, which isn't a huge deal.  I don't mind turning the whole set to get a better viewing angle.All in all, this TV is a great purchase if you are looking for a medium sized LCD television for a casual, enhanced experience.  The picture is great, the color levels are vibrant, the size is awesome, there are plenty of inputs/outputs, it's 1080p, and the TV itself is one of the best looking sets in its category.  Of course this TV isn't meant to be the main attraction in your home theater setup.. but you know that already.  From my research and comparisons, this TV is your best deal by far for its category and it definitely gets its job done.  JR.com sold it to me for $450.00, shipped it to me quick (free shipping at that), and even added some extra packing material inside to make sure it arrived in mint condition.  I'm more than happy with my purchase and so is my girlfriend!

Reviews.Title: Looks great. Sounds great. Great price.
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Best Buy on sale for 399. Incredible price for a very nice display. I have it connected to standard definition FIOS, which looks better than I would expect after adjusting picture size/shape. The most surprising feature was the sound. It sounds very good - much better than any other TV in our house. Additionally, this unit appears black at first, but upon closer inspection you can see that it fades to an ultra dark blue at the bottom.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Hoots
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv last weekend after many hours of research, got free two day shipping with the amazon prime trial, and am enjoying its amazing picture right now.  It was a breeze to set up, it looks great, and it was a tremendous value for the money.  It has a bunch of connection slots too.  In short, if you can get this tv for under five hundred bucks you should definitely do so.

Reviews.Title: an excellent 37" LCD TV for the money
Reviews.Author: hal
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV from Amazon, and it was delivered when they said.  Very easy to set up and adjust. Has very good picture and excellent HDTV. I used just one HDMI cable from the top box into the HDMI on the TV, and everything works great. Set came adjusted for "Auto Aspect" on. If you want a full screen all the time, go into menu and set "Auto Aspect" to off, otherwise you will not have a full 37" screen picture.

Reviews.Title: TOSHIBA 37E200U 37-inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: Nonni4hlk
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Toshiba HDTV and all I can say is you can't ever go wrong with Toshiba.  I love this TV.  I love all my Toshibas and I got them all on Amazon.com!  I am very fussy when it comes to skin tones and these TV's deliver life-like skin tones....after some adjusting, of course! Also, the oranges/reds are not neon and the greens are true grass-green. The remote is very user-friendly. Sound quality is typical for a flat screen...if you want a theater sound you'll need to place additional speakers. I know that it has other capabilities, tech-wise, but I don't buy a TV for gaming or streaming or whatever so the reader will have to check on the actual specs to get all that info.  All in all a great TV!  I did get the extended warranty on this one because it was reasonable and the company got very high ratings.  Delivery was to my door and piece of cake to install!

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Adeola M Akinola
Reviews.Content: This t. May not have all the bells and whistles on newer hdtv's but it is still high quality. The picture is great and the kind of oval design adds to the decor of any room. It's got lots of hdmi inputs and the ability to exclude inputs which is nice so u can turn on only the ones you are using which is quite handy. Overall good buy,I have no complaints at this time.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: ~Emily~
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with this television. Picture quality, sound quality and overall quality in general is great. I bought this TV after going through 2 VIZIO's from Walmart (both of which died within 60 days) and am super pleased to get this one instead. The bottom of the frame lights up a slightly blue color (hard to explain) and it's really pretty. I am very happy I bought this TV and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Reynolds
Reviews.Content: This Toshiba 37 inch TV is fabulous. Definitely the best 37 inch model available and the sound quality is just fine.If you're looking for a 37 inch LCD, look no further.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 37"1080P
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I love the TV, and It made a big hit having a black box with my wife. The TV blends in well with out TV cabinet, and our wall colors. Very impressed but with two Hondas & a Toshiba laptop, it does not suprise me about the Japaneese quality, and they have always raised that bar to a new high.

Reviews.Title: 1080p at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Brett Giordano
Reviews.Content: Paid about $350 for a 37" 1080p TV.  I have not see a better price anywhere for this size and quality of TV.  The picture is great and sound is reasonable for a flat screen.  Highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a TV this size.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for my dollar
Reviews.Author: LJC
Reviews.Content: I am a person who does not jump on the technology bandwagon immediately, but waits for items to come down to a reasonable price.  This is my first HD TV, and I am very pleased with it. The picture is excellent, the remote is simple to understand. User manual was clear and menus are good.  I rated the sound quality as OK, but I would say it is probably as good as most TVs.  With my surround speakers I am spoiled on sound. I am thrilled with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: I'm blown away!
Reviews.Author: bugsbunny2795
Reviews.Content: I'm so freaking happy with my new TV!!! Where do I start? The stars on Star Wars are white. Due to pixels in the old TV the stars were red blue and yellow. The pixels couldn't show tiny white stars. But with my new Toshiba I can see the stars as white. I'm enjoying Star Wars all over again. It's very big for only 37 inches. I'm shocked at how big it really is. James Bond has been more enjoyable than usual. My next step is to get a home theatre sound system, then I'll be jammin!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: savontay
Reviews.Content: The best deal I can find for $400.  Have only been able to watch in 1080i. I think that's the highest resolution my cable provider Time Warner goes up to.  Nevertheless, picture quality is good but gets a bit fuzzy (a little too much for my liking) when watching basketball games.  I'd recommend trying a 120hz or higher tv if you're a true sports fan; for smoother motion. Although the tv sounds find to me, I don't think it has dolby digital, but PCM instead.  For some reason, my time warner remote is acting up. Sometimes, I have to press the remote like 5 times for it to respond.  Not sure if it's an issue with the cable box or the tv, or a combination of both. Overall, i'm satisfied. Its well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture!  Crystal Clear!
Reviews.Author: T. Richard "Christian Soldier"
Reviews.Content: I lovw when I can buy a TV and it arrives at my house in just a few days...for free!  I saw where some reviewers had their TV stolen from their porch but we were contacted by the delivery service and had to st up a time we would be home.Let me say that the picture is crystal clear, especially on the 1080 HD channels.  But, even the standard def channels come in a lot better.  My mother-in-law bought a 52 inch LG a year before we purchased this TV and the difference of picture quality is overwhelming.  She comments on how clear our picture is every time she is at our house.I love the brrightness settings (Standard, Sports, Movie).  It is neat to be able to choose based on what you are watching.  It is also very to setup and operate.  The menu is very user friendly.  The only negative is the sound quality.  TV is fine but when watching a movie it just isn't that loud.  I wish the speaker system was a little better quality.  But, it is a small negative compared to all the positives.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD VALUE
Reviews.Author: mandy
Reviews.Content: AFTER PURCHASING A 37" VIZIO MODEL--AND RETURNING IT FOR MECHANICAL DEFECTS, I DECIDED TO TRY THIS UNIT BASED ON ITS REVIEWS.  WHAT A DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TWO.  THE TOSHIBA'S SOUND AND PICTURE QUALITY IS VASTLY SUPERIOR TO THE SIMILAR VIZIO.  THAT'S THE GOOD NEWS: THE BAD NEWS IS LIKE A FEW PAST REVIEWERS HAVE STATED, THE STAND IS VERY FLIMZY.  I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND IT FOR A HOUSEHOLD WITH SMALL CHILDREN WHERE THE TV WILL BE PLACED WHERE THEY CAN TOUCH IT.  OTHER THAN THAT, IT'S A GREAT BARGAIN AT $449.00 AT AMAZON.  IF IT HAD A STRONGER STAND I WOULD HAVE RATED IT A 5.

Reviews.Title: Supposed to be Refurbished but Lines All across Screen, Can't Even Watch
Reviews.Author: ShrtStf
Reviews.Content: So I bought this refurbished from BTV AMERICA INC and the horizontal lines across the screen were so bad I couldn't do the set up menu.  I don't believe that it was in fact refurbished.  The lines come and go but I also get a double picture where the image ont he screen appears twice, once on each side of the screen.  Currently trying to get Toshiba to recognize the warranty which I received with the TV.  You get 90 days with a refurbished item but they have it in their system registered to the original owner so this is posing a problem.  They won't send anyone to look at it until they confirm my warranty.  How they are going to do that I do not know.  Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba TV
Reviews.Author: Andrea D. Polack
Reviews.Content: This is my second Toshiba TV purchase within the last year, the first for the bedroom, and this larger model for the family room. It was on the basis of my very good experience with the first one that I decided to do the 37-inch in Toshiba as well.  They really make an excellent product.  You will not be disappointed.Andrea

Reviews.Title: Superb quality, performance and price!
Reviews.Author: Chuck Lawrence "cwlbabydoc"
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for serious videophile looking for that just right fit! My six year old 27 inch CRT was the heaviest set my bedroom wall mount could safely hold and since getting into HD with my initial 60 inch Sony for the living room, I longed for the same 1080p quality in my room. The Toshiba had a mounting bracket that was a perfect template for marking drill holes in my old wall mount's resting plate, so with little work I could maintain the perfect height for supine viewing. HDMI connection made hook up simple, as did optical audio out from the TV to my non-HDMI older receiver for bigger audio. It was less than half the weight of the CRT model, and there is still 4 inches of clearance to the ceiling!

Reviews.Title: Crisp and Clear!
Reviews.Author: Eyenstein
Reviews.Content: This TV has exceeded my expectations, I owned a couple Visios both I loved, but even at 60hz this thing has an incredible picture. The sound is better than what others are saying just need to set some advanced settings. I use it with my laptop and primarily with My Xbox over HDMI for gaming, ESPN3 and Netflix. Great buy

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: HCMalebranche
Reviews.Content: Trust me, I did my due diligence because I was not prepared to spend this kind of money and not feel like I was getting everything that I wanted.1) I have it in my bedroom, it may be a bit big for a bedroom (head of bed ~9ft away) but the picture quality is great. I do not have an HD feed until the first of the month and even with "SD" coming through almost all of the pictures show a noticed improved picture quality. ESPN is not good quality but that should change next week when im viewing it in HD!2) its a 1080p, which is the best available resolution an I was still able to get it at a great price in what i consider to be a big size.3) only "con" i have to report is that it takes a solid 3-4 seconds for the picture to come on when you price power. I have a feeling that may be standard, and if it is not then you can consider it a con. Other than that this is an awesome set and you wont be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: TV great but problem was with my old stereo
Reviews.Author: C. Michaels "Miami Fusion"
Reviews.Content: As a single female with absolutely, (and gleefully) no male influence for purchasing the latest and pricey electronics, I carefully read reviews and selected the Toshiba.  Like most reviews everything was fine except the sound was indeed flat as expected. So I thought I would just connect it to my old- but- still- very stylish, mini Panasonic stereo system which still provides great surround sound. Lo and behold, it turns out I'm the dinosaur in not keeping up with technology. The Toshiba did not allow me to connect the Red and White RCA cables to the TV. There is only a "DIGITAL AUDIO OUTPUT".  Here is where a tech saavy boyfriend does come in handy.Hence after significant more research and phone calls, I was out of luck. Sadly I had to return the television although it was at a great price. But I insisted on NOT buying a new stereo system which cost on average $200-$300. So I ended up with a Samsung 40" even larger TV for $579 at Best Buy and it has the connections for my old stereo. So everything worked out in the end. The lesson learned is that I had to research the manuals online for TVs (in order to have clear visual of all the connection in back of the TV) and Samsung is the best for providing this easily and readily online. I was leaning toward an LG but they do not readily have manuals online. But I love Amazon's easy and free 30 day return.

Reviews.Title: Nice while it lasted-which wasn't long enough!
Reviews.Author: James D Hall
Reviews.Content: I bought a similar Toshiba 37" lcd tv in Sept. of 2009.  I did not buy the extended warranty because I had always heard that Toshiba was a great brand (and I had a Toshiba tube tv before which worked for years) & thought it would be a waste of money.  My bad! It was great until this week when the screen started going black.  I called Toshiba & they gave me names of authorized repair joints. They really didnt seem to care that I had barely gotten 2 years out of this tv.  I asked if this was a recurring problem & they said no (of course).  Took it to the repair shop & was told the main board & power supply were both bad & it would cost $400 to fix (only paid $600 for the tv).  Called Toshiba back to express my great disapointment in the quality of the tv & was told that ALL lcd tv's are very complex & there is no guaranteed life on any brand.  I told the guy then I would rather pay $350 for another brand that may or may not last over 2 years instead of $600 for a Toshiba.  Better to spend $350 every couple of years than $600. I did start looking for any other reports like mine & there were ALOT. I might not have been as angry with the quality of the tv had Toshiba's customer service been more helpful. Apparantly Toshiba isnt quite as reliable as they used to be.

Reviews.Title: Great....just DON'T use the base
Reviews.Author: J. S. Whitehead
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews give great details about specs and stuff. The TV does work great and I'm completely satisfied, except for the cheap flimsy base that comes with it. I don't know why they even include it since the 2 little plastic tabs that suppose to keep the TV from sliding off the base don't work at all. All it takes is a little bump and it will come falling down. I'm glad I purchased the wall mount for it, cause the base is crap. I just used the base for the couple days I had it setup before I mounted it. Luckily my wife saw it start to tip over and did a goalie dive over the bed to catch it. So it didn't hit the ground very hard and still works great.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture and very good sound...
Reviews.Author: "CLR"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this TV at a local store and paid a bit more, so the price on Amazon is quite good. We decided to purchase it because we have owned Toshiba's before and have been very pleased.Surprisingly easy to set-up, maybe 10-15 minutes. The plugs are very easy to access and are on the side of the TV.Picture quality was nice, but once we had the cable company hook up the HD the picture was of very high quality. We own a much more expensive flatscreen and after checking back and forth the picture's are much the same.Very pleased with the sound. The speakers are out the back which gave us a moment of hesitation... whether we would be happy with the sound and might have to purchase speakers but decided to give it a try first. The sound is very audible not necessitating a separate sound system.We are very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Super Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Mary B.
Reviews.Content: Great TV, has better sound quality than other big screen TVs.  It is connected to a Sony NSZ-GS7 Internet Player, X-Box, computer, and DVD player and it still has ports to spare!

Reviews.Title: OK, but there are better ones available
Reviews.Author: Henri Paul Talisker "Scotch on the Rocks"
Reviews.Content: For the money, it's not bad, but we relegated it to the basement after buying a 40 inch Sony Bravio for just a bit more than we paid for the Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Once Redeemed
Reviews.Content: Have had this for 2 years now and still very happy with it. The picture and color are clear; size is perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the spare room
Reviews.Author: Rich D in Ventura CA
Reviews.Content: This was perfect as a spare bedroom TV and the price was awesome. If you want smart features, (Netflix, Amazon streaming, etc) you should get a smart DVD player or  something along those lines.

Reviews.Title: lcd hd tv
Reviews.Author: Francisco  Ferreira
Reviews.Content: This Toshiba LCD HDTV it truth to it name, the black gloss is beautiful (if you like black) and the images are really clear.beautiful colors.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV
Reviews.Author: cd
Reviews.Content: There are probably better, cheaper TV's out there nowadays but when I bought this one it was very affordable and has served us very well.  No issues at all - I would definitely consider a Toshiba again.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but problems
Reviews.Author: Guy Berry "Guy B"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV based on the great reviews.  About 6 months into the product,  it started having streaks across the screen.  I contact Toshiba who sent a tech to replace the unit.  Now,  just a little over 1 year of ownership,  it is happening again on he 2nd unit.  But,  Toshiba tells me that their two year warranty only covers one year and the 2nd year is covered by the seller.  No where can I contact AMAZON so I have sent message to the Seller.  Again,  no phone number on their site so I am emailing them.'Beware of this product because it seems to have some type of defect.

Reviews.Title: Great value TV, exactly as advertised
Reviews.Author: Ari R.
Reviews.Content: This 37-Inch Toshiba has treated me very well. Easy to set up, easy to use, and have not had a single problem since buying it 18 months ago. As long as you understand what you're buying (a good, solid TV - but not top of the line), no reason not to love it.

Reviews.Title: excellent television, high resolution,
Reviews.Author: Jose
Reviews.Content: excellent television, high resolution,the one doesn't have exits of audio 5.1 analogous, only optic audio out

Reviews.Title: LA MEJOR OPCION EN HDTV
Reviews.Author: H. Talavera "friendly manitoba"
Reviews.Content: Una exelente eleccion tiene una apariencia digna de lo mejor, los colores y definicion son hermosos, facil de instalar con garantia y asistencia en todo pais latinoamericano, calidad para EEUU, facilidad para usarlo como pantalla en internet, sonido claro , preciosa imagen, es la mejor opcion y el mejor precio que pude encontrar.Consideralo realmente estoy muy satisfecho y lo disfruto apenas llego a casa.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Grace Thomas
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my mother in law... set up was amazingly easy ... the picture & sound quality are wonderful - overall we are very satisfied with this TV....

Reviews.Title: Somewhat disappointed with this product.
Reviews.Author: M. Tribble "Wood Guy"
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with almost everything about this TV. The two issues I have is occasionally (1-3 times daily) audio and video drops out for approximately 3-4 seconds. This happens when watching live TV or DVR programs and the Closed Caption feature works only with standard audio/video connection, not with HDMI. I would go with a Sony the next time.

Reviews.Title: Great deal!
Reviews.Author: Opeth666
Reviews.Content: I bought this on sale with no interest for 2 years and am very happy with it. It has a good picture but nothing beats my panasonic PLASMA!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 37E200U
Reviews.Author: Scott Schlosser
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice television at a great price.  The picture is fantastic, especially when the HD show is being broadcast at 1080p.  It is amazingly thin and very light weight so setting it up and/or moving it doesn't require a crane!

Reviews.Title: Review Of Toshiba 37E200U 37 inch TV 1080 LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Owen Samuel
Reviews.Content: I am very happy and impress with this Tv. It was a good buy, it works well and has an excellent colour. The transaction was very good and professional. I would shop with seller again.

Reviews.Title: A very happy customer
Reviews.Author: Judy Yandell
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying a new television.  It paid off, we are very happy with the quality of the TV, and the price was great, however two days after I ordered mine the price went down.I should have waited a few more days!Judy

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: Benjamin M. Grant
Reviews.Content: Overall this is an outstanding product, with a great picture in 480, 720 or 1080i do wish it had a wake up function so I can wake up to the news, alas one more button to push.

Reviews.Title: Run, Run, Run Away From All Things Toshiba
Reviews.Author: TV Fan
Reviews.Content: Truthfully, I forget how well the Toshiba TV I purchased in Nov 2010 works.  It quit in January 2011.  The main board is "out."  It is on two month backorder.  My TV is four months old and has only worked for two.  The required part does not exist on this continent.  I accept the bad luck of buying a "one in a 1,000" bad TV among many perfectly fine ones.  I do not accept the ineptitude of not having the repair channel supplied with parts to help those poor saps who happened to get a bad one.If lemon laws applied to electronics as they do for autos, Toshiba would be forced to take return & provide another TV.  I advise running from all Toshiba products because of their policy and the approach of their customer service department.  They are content to sell me a product that does not work two months later and can't be fixed for another 60 days.  That is unacceptable.  (Repair may be longer - who knows)  I know enough to form an opinion and share with any who will listen.  No female has EVER been given my name.  Yet, customer service replies to my letters with a "Sir/Madam" salutation.  They are a case study in how to offend and under serve customers.You may be OK and get a working product.  Don't expect a remedy from Toshiba, if you don't.  Thankfully, their industry is competitive enough so that I will NEVER have to take that chance again.  Run, run, run away ...

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: Tagi
Reviews.Content: I really loved the Toshiba LCD TV.  Very good delivery although it was not by traditional companies such as UPS or FedEX.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but why the half mute?
Reviews.Author: Pearl
Reviews.Content: This TV has stunning picture quality and acceptable sound, plenty of plugs for accessories, and a simple and understandable remote.My only gripe is that the mute button first steps through a half mute as if to say 'Are you sure you want to mute??'Wish they had left mute as a simple on/off.

Reviews.Title: not bad for used
Reviews.Author: ordinary joe
Reviews.Content: So far everything is good . it is a used product so hopefully I won't be made a liar after the first year. It's just enough of what I was looking for. Plenty big enough screen, sound is clear, easy to operate. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Missing screw...otherwise great!
Reviews.Author: Breedwell
Reviews.Content: Just got it today, very prompt. Only problem I have is that I only received 3 of the 4 screws needed to fasten the stand onto the television. The fourth screw I got was much smaller and totally different than the others. I think this is more of an issue with the vendor I purchased it from.Update: Bought this TV over a year ago and I've put great use into it. My friends and I have used it daily for hours at a time (video games, movies, and the like) with no real problems.The only real issue is some sort of glitch with the Netflix application on Xbox360. When used in tandem with an HDMI cable I purchased on Amazon, there's a small bug that makes us have to restart the TV after watching a movie/show. However, I don't think it is the TV's fault as this bug doesn't exist when we use composite cables with the Xbox (HD or standard).Otherwise the functionality has been perfect and the settings allow for pretty vast customization of your viewing experience. I would recommend anyone to get the TV, it definitely is worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: great bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: David A. Kettwig "Tucson Dave"
Reviews.Content: TV was as expected....great picture quality....sound is like all HDTV's, flat and monoral....but adequate for bedroom viewing...a sound system is a must if you desire souund stereo quality...

Reviews.Title: A good 37 inch TV
Reviews.Author: "Wild Honey-U2" "ebr/U2"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about a month. I have two other Toshiba's, a 22 inch and a 26 inch, the sound isn't very good on those sets. They are in the bedroom, which is okay. I bought this TV for the living room, which has a very good sound.  Buying from Amazon.com is the best, great price and very good customer service.  Thanks, Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Value and picture!
Reviews.Author: Richard Sayerwin
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the 37 inch Toshiba for my daughter....She used to have the 40 inch Sony but this has a better picture for hundreds less...Easy setup...easy remote buttons...Picked this tv up for 450.00 on sale..The sound is great too!...The volume goes to 100 but we keep it on 11.....The regular defintion channels come in good also...I made a wise choice!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: The tv is excellent and the delivery from Amazon was also excellent. Was very easy to set up and start watching.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 37 inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: mnnbruns
Reviews.Content: Toshiba TV arrived in well protected box. The set up was very easy. The picture quality is excellent--although we are not hooked up to a high def package yet.

Reviews.Title: Great Value-- Better than Expected
Reviews.Author: Roger Hayes
Reviews.Content: This is our first HDTV and for $495 we are glad we waited. It really makes tv watching more enjoyable and combined with an Apple TV and Netflix it is almost addictive. Set up is very easy and many more devices can be attached. I have Dishnetwork as my service. We love it!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 37E200U HDTV
Reviews.Author: Nevada Dean
Reviews.Content: This LCD HDTV is fantastic. Price was fabulous too! Setup was very easy and the picture is as good as any I have seen and better than most. Fit perfectly into bedroom armoire. I am extremely pleased with this unit. Couldn't have found anything better!

Reviews.Title: It worked!!  Convenient, though about $100 more.
Reviews.Author: alizamanian
Reviews.Content: We have two more TV's from this manufacturer and have been very happy with the quality.  So, we went back to them for the third one.

Reviews.Title: Screen quality
Reviews.Author: Etienne
Reviews.Content: I am very unhappy with the blank screen of this unit. The left side is gray, the middle is dark gray and the right top side has a big light flair coming in from the corner and the bottom right corner has the same light flair, this very annoying when you view it at the 3/4 ratio with defective black on the left and especially right side. The picture quality is acceptable to me, I have it in my bedroom so I never turned up the sound to high so I have no problem with the sound.I would never recommend this unit

Reviews.Title: Toshiba TV
Reviews.Author: SJ Cain
Reviews.Content: Not impressed!!!!  Had to call Toshiba for help.  Nothing worked, they had to send a tech out who took the new set to be fixed.  Got it the day before Thanksgiving, here it is December 1 when the repair was scheduled, but it could not be repaired so it is gone until the end of next week which is December 7-10th.  That will be 2 weeks plus maybe 2-3 days without the new Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Barely gets the job done...
Reviews.Author: M. W. Park
Reviews.Content: IF you told me that this TV was a 2006 model, I would've been really happy.But as a 2010 model, it leaves a lot to be desired.My review is in comparison with low to mid-level models from Sony, Vizio, LG, and Samsung..First, SDTV quality is pretty poor.. So poor that you want to go outside and enjoy the sun.HD quality is pretty decent, but it's still not up to PAR.The menu is pretty confusing, and it won't remember input settings last used.  This is very annoying.  Everytime I connected my computer to the TV using HDMI, I had to setup the TV again and againg..The remote looks cheaper than the universal remote from the 99-cent store.Yes, the price is cheap, but I didn't know the TV quality will be THIS cheap.I actually returned this TV at the end and decided that I rather be outside playing in the sun than watch this low quality display.BUT!!! if this is your FIRST HDTV, you won't know the "bad" parts of it.. you'll simply be AMAZED...

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 37 inch LCD Model #37E200U
Reviews.Author: Mark Smith
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is excellent. My only complaint is the sound quality is not as good as my 52 inch Sony Bravia.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the money
Reviews.Author: J. C. Harrington
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Toshiba TV about a month ago. The choice was driven by the size of an existing built-in cabinet, and the TV fits perfectly in that space. It couldn't look any nicer there. The picture quality is good, and I like being able to switch between different display settings. The sound is good, and my boyfriend was able to connect his ipod to the TV easily. My only complaint is that I have a Toshiba laptop that I'd like to connect to the TV, but the audio ports are not compatible. The audio input for the TV isn't standard, and my laptop doesn't have the ports it requires. Since both devices are Toshiba, I expected that they would connect very easily. I planned to use my laptop as a dvd player, so I'm very disappointed. I also wanted to use the TV as a monitor for the laptop to view YouTube videos, etc. This is a major limitation of the TV, and it wasn't something I would have thought to look for before purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: not a favorable comparison to my 42' toshiba regza, i'm disappointed with it's picture quality!
Reviews.Author: Janet L. Wittenborn
Reviews.Content: the picture quality has a lot to be desired compared to my toshiba 42"regza. it has very little clarity. no comparison.  the regza is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 37E200U
Reviews.Author: Tommy
Reviews.Content: I love this TV very much. The only thing that's need to be improve is the packing. I dont know how did the seller paking their product, But when I received the tv the box were all ripped and very dirty. Anyway the most important thing is the tv is still functional...............

Reviews.Title: Picture went out - no local repair shop.  Toshiba no help.
Reviews.Author: Jaytee "business user"
Reviews.Content: Bought a Toshiba 37" Regza through Amazon in October 2008 for $750.00 along with 2 year warranty.  Picture went out in January of 2011, 3 months out of warranty. Toshiba says they cannot repair - referred me to a repair shop 75 miles away.  Called local Geek Squad who checked it out and said main computer board had to be replaced at a cost of $500+ including labor - and that is if they can get the part from Toshiba.  At today's prices I can get a new Vizio for less than that so I'm stuck with a beautiful looking Toshiba television that doesn't work and is too expensive to fix.  Whatever happened to quality workmanship?  I still have a 30 year old Sony Trinitron from my college days that works fine!!  I won't buy another Toshiba product.

ProductInfo.Features:
37.6-inch LCD HDTV with Full 1080p HD resolution; slimming tapered bezel and attractive front panel Horizon design gradation
DynaLight backlight control adjusts for deeper black levels for higher dynamic contrast and more realistic picture
Photo Frame capability for showing off your digital photo slideshows; USB connection for playing MP3 digital audio
Inputs: 4 HDMI, 1 component, 2 composite, 1 PC, 1 USB, 1 optical digital audio output
Includes removable stand; measures 36.40 x 26.00 x 11.61 inches with stand
1080P Full High-Definition Cinespeed Display
Dynalight Dynamic Backlight Control For Deep Black Levels
Gaming Mode For Fast Game Controller Response
Photo Frame Capability & Mp3 Playback Via Usb
ProductInfo.Name: Toshiba 37E200U 37-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LCD HDTV (Black Gloss)
